article_title: U.S. blacklists over 50 Chinese companies in bid to curb Beijing's AI, chip capabilities
summary: The U.S. recently added over 50 Chinese tech companies to its export blacklist to curb Beijing's advancements in artificial intelligence and computing capabilities. The move prohibits American companies from supplying to these blacklisted entities without government permits. These organizations were accused of acting against U.S. national security interests, particularly in developing advanced AI, supercomputers, and high-performance AI chips. The Chinese government strongly condemned the export restrictions. The U.S. aims to prevent adversarial misuse of American technology, emphasizing national security concerns.
